abstract: JPMorgan Chase on Thursday announced a $2.7 billion second-quarter profit from stellar trading and investment banking results. That’s up 36 percent from the comparable quarter in 2008. Meanwhile, Henry M. Paulson Jr., the former Treasury secretary, is scheduled to testify this morning before Congress about his role in persuading Bank of America to buy Merrill Lynch.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase on Thursday announced a $2.7 billion second-quarter profit from stellar trading and investment banking results. That’s up 36 percent from the comparable quarter in 2008. Meanwhile, Henry M. Paulson Jr., the former Treasury secretary...
lead_paragraph: Even as it weathers the worst economic downturn in decades, JPMorgan Chase on Thursday announced a $2.7 billion second-quarter profit from stellar trading and investment banking results. That’s up 36 percent from the comparable quarter in 2008, and well above the average estimate from Wall Street analysts.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Profit Soars; Paulson on the Hill

abstract: Even as it weathers the worst economic downturn in decades, JPMorgan Chase on Thursday announced a $2.7 billion second-quarter profit from stellar trading and investment banking results.
snippet: Even as it weathers the worst economic downturn in decades, JPMorgan Chase on Thursday announced a $2.7 billion second-quarter profit from stellar trading and investment banking results.
lead_paragraph: Even as it weathers the worst economic downturn in decades, JPMorgan Chase on Thursday announced a $2.7 billion second-quarter profit from stellar trading and investment banking results, The New York Times’s Eric Dash writes.

headline.main: JPMorgan’s Profit Soars Past Wall St. Estimates

abstract: A new order is emerging on Wall Street — one in which Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase are starting to tower over former financial titans.
snippet: A new order is emerging on Wall Street — one in which Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase are starting to tower over former financial titans.
lead_paragraph: A new order is emerging on Wall Street after the worst crisis since the Great Depression  one in which just a couple of victors are starting to tower over the handful of financial titans that used to dominate the industry.

headline.main: Two Giants Emerge From Wall Street Ruins
headline.print_headline: 2 GIANTS EMERGE FROM THE RUINS ON WALL STREET

abstract: JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive said Thursday that a failure of CIT Group, the struggling commercial lender, would not have a material effect on his company or throw the financial system into disarray.
snippet: JPMorgan Chase’s chief executive said Thursday that a failure of CIT Group, the struggling commercial lender, would not have a material effect on his company or throw the financial system into disarray.
lead_paragraph: CIT Group is struggling to avert a bankruptcy filing, but Jamie Dimon, the chief executive of JPMorgan Chase, says his bank won’t take a major hit if the commercial lender fails.

abstract: It is a great time to be a banker. The bonuses are back and the profit margins are huge. Too bad the financial system isn’t working well for the rest of us.
snippet: It is a great time to be a banker. The bonuses are back and the profit margins are huge. Too bad the financial system isn’t working well for the rest of us.
lead_paragraph: The earnings announcements by Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase — along with the impending bankruptcy of CIT — show this is a great time to be a banker.

headline.main: A Great Time to Be a Banker
